criteria: Accuracy of Shape Identification and Application
descriptions: Student incorrectly identifies geometric shapes or does not attempt to apply them to describe real-world objects.
Student identifies geometric shapes but struggles to apply them accurately to describe real-world objects; descriptions are vague or inappropriate.
Student identifies basic geometric shapes and attempts to apply them to describe real-world objects, but with some inaccuracies or oversimplifications.
Student accurately identifies common geometric shapes and applies them to describe real-world objects with reasonable accuracy, although some details may be overlooked.
Student accurately identifies a variety of geometric shapes and applies them effectively to describe real-world objects, demonstrating a good understanding of geometric properties.

Student expertly identifies and applies geometric shapes to create detailed and accurate models of real-world objects, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of geometric properties and their applications.
The shapes chosen are not at all appropriate for modeling the given objects.
The shapes chosen are questionably appropriate for modeling the given objects, and there is little justification.
The shapes chosen are somewhat appropriate for modeling the given objects, but the reasoning is not strong.
The shapes chosen are generally appropriate for modeling the given objects, and the reasoning is adequate.
The shapes chosen are well-suited for modeling the given objects, and the reasoning is clear and logical.
The shapes chosen are exceptionally well-suited for modeling the given objects, demonstrating keen insight and a sophisticated understanding.
Student provides no mathematical justification for their shape selections or descriptions.
Student attempts to provide mathematical justification, but it is unclear, incomplete, or inaccurate.
Student provides some mathematical justification for their shape selections, but it lacks detail or contains minor errors.
Student provides adequate mathematical justification for their shape selections, demonstrating a basic understanding of relevant geometric properties.
Student provides clear and accurate mathematical justification for their shape selections, demonstrating a solid understanding of relevant geometric properties.

Student provides insightful and comprehensive mathematical justification for their shape selections, demonstrating a deep understanding of relevant geometric properties and their application in modeling.
